results.title: The Long road to independence
results.creator_credit: Mohammed Abdur Rahman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Serving in the Australian army in East Timor, Mohammed Abdur Rahman and his fellow soldiers were attacked by the Indonesian army many times and involved in some highly publicized events. Over time, Rahman became quite connected to the nation and its people, performing humanitarian work and witnessing East Timor’s struggle towards independence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mohammed Abdur Rahman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Serving in the Australian army in East Timor, Mohammed Abdur Rahman and his fellow soldiers were attacked by the Indonesian army many times and involved in some highly publicized events. Over time, Rahman became quite connected to the nation and its people, performing humanitarian work and witnessing East Timor’s struggle towards independence.

Over time, Rahman became quite connected to the nation and its people, performing humanitarian work and witnessing East Timor’s struggle towards independence.

results.title: Growing up fast
results.creator_credit: John Croxford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It was itchy feet that encouraged John Croxford to join the Australian Navy. He spent most of his time patrolling the Korean coast where there was no room for mistakes.

results.title: All the days of my life
results.creator_credit: Joan Johnstone and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: In 1941, the Australian Women’s Army Services was formed and Joan chose to join the AWAS to fight for Australia. Her dad was in the army as was missing in action. Joan was transferred to work on Salt, the official army publication. It was called Salt because salt was so essential to life. Joan’s story is about her service, her marriage and her work with Salt.
results.description: In 1941, the Australian Women’s Army Services was formed and Joan chose to join the AWAS to fight for Australia. Her dad was in the army as was missing in action. Joan was transferred to work on Salt, the official army publication. It was called Salt because salt was so essential to life. Joan’s story is about her service, her marriage and her work with Salt.
description_for_label: In 1941, the Australian Women’s Army Services was formed and Joan chose to join the AWAS to fight for Australia. Her dad was in the army as was missing in action. Joan was transferred to work on Salt, the official army publication. It was called Salt because salt was so essential to life. Joan’s story is about her service, her marriage and her work with Salt.

results.title: Fancy that
results.creator_credit: Joan Johnstone and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: When Joan showed a photo of her new boyfriend to her mother, her mother remarked that he looked a lot like Selby Adams, a british pen friend she wrote to in World War I. Joan served in the Austrlalian Women’s Army Service during World War II and, as a result of that service, was able to re-unite her mother with her pen friend from Britain. An amazing coincidence
results.description: When Joan showed a photo of her new boyfriend to her mother, her mother remarked that he looked a lot like Selby Adams, a british pen friend she wrote to in World War I. Joan served in the Austrlalian Women’s Army Service during World War II and, as a result of that service, was able to re-unite her mother with her pen friend from Britain. An amazing coincidence

results.title: Decidedly out of this world
results.creator_credit: Joan Rossi and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: In 1939, Prime Minister Menzies announced that Britain was at war with Germany and that, as a result, Australia is at war with Germany. Joan Rossi talks about how she joined the army in 1941 and subsequent training, her work as a Syphon Officer, moving to Brisbane and tells of how she decoded the sinking of the ship Centaur. Post war, Joan still helped out at RAAF, helping other women find work before finding her own job and settling into post war life
results.description: In 1939, Prime Minister Menzies announced that Britain was at war with Germany and that, as a result, Australia is at war with Germany. Joan Rossi talks about how she joined the army in 1941 and subsequent training, her work as a Syphon Officer, moving to Brisbane and tells of how she decoded the sinking of the ship Centaur. Post war, Joan still helped out at RAAF, helping other women find work before finding her own job and settling into post war life
description_for_label: In 1939, Prime Minister Menzies announced that Britain was at war with Germany and that, as a result, Australia is at war with Germany. Joan Rossi talks about how she joined the army in 1941 and subsequent training, her work as a Syphon Officer, moving to Brisbane and tells of how she decoded the sinking of the ship Centaur. Post war, Joan still helped out at RAAF, helping other women find work before finding her own job and settling into post war life

results.title: My life in the war years = My life during the war years
results.creator_credit: May Donovan and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: May Donovan was a young woman when World War II broke out. She speaks about her life in Melbourne and how she was affected by the war, despite being so far away. She is a member of the Victorian War Widows Guild and created this digital story in memory of Pat Medaris
results.title_for_label: My life in the war years = My life during the war years

results.title: The Lucky years
results.creator_credit: Brian Luscombe and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Brian Luscombe enlisted in the Air Force on Australia Day 1942. He was 18 and wanted to be a pilot. Dubbed Lucky Luscombe, Brian talks about his years as a pilot in the RAAF in World War II
results.description: Brian Luscombe enlisted in the Air Force on Australia Day 1942. He was 18 and wanted to be a pilot. Dubbed Lucky Luscombe, Brian talks about his years as a pilot in the RAAF in World War II

results.title: When quiet came
results.creator_credit: Bill Flowers and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Bill Flowers tells his story of how he was captured by the Japanese and sent to Changi as a POW. His tale is one of survival. Bill was in the 2/9th Field Ambulance during World War II. This digital story was recorded as part of In Our Words : Stories from Victorian Veterans digital storytelling workshop
results.description: Bill Flowers tells his story of how he was captured by the Japanese and sent to Changi as a POW. His tale is one of survival. Bill was in the 2/9th Field Ambulance during World War II. This digital story was recorded as part of In Our Words : Stories from Victorian Veterans digital storytelling workshop
description_for_label: Bill Flowers tells his story of how he was captured by the Japanese and sent to Changi as a POW. His tale is one of survival. Bill was in the 2/9th Field Ambulance during World War II. This digital story was recorded as part of In Our Words : Stories from Victorian Veterans digital storytelling workshop

results.title: A Look from their side
results.creator_credit: Robert Cole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Reflecting on his service in Borneo during World War II, Robert Cole was impressed by the kindness and warmth of the local people, despite being forced to live through war and poverty. In doing so, they taught Cole about gratitude.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Cole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
